reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A League Tragedy
reviews.reviewText: This story was very engaging, even though I knew how things were gonna end I was still invested with how the story progressed. The main character's struggle to do everything in their power to avert disaster but stay true to their bonds was heartbreaking but made me admire them so much more. I love League lore, just going through the story and recognizing elements from the game and other stories was super fun. Book confirmed just how deep these characters actually are and how they're more than just mascots, they're people with their own beliefs and values clashing against each doing what they believe is right. Don't think you even need to be a League fan to enjoy it, just a good story for anyone to get invested in.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great book, even if you aren't a League of Legends mega-fan
reviews.reviewText: A friend recommended this book for our book club. I was hesitant at first because I don't know too much about the lore of LoL, but it turns out that you can pick this book up without a familiarity with the LoL universe. It is a very epic story that will keep you hooked and wanting the answers hidden in the next page just as much as the characters in the book. I highly recommend this book. Great job to the author Anthony Reynolds.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’m someone who is learning the lore of league of legends and omg this story was amazing! Would highly recommend both book and audio the acting was incredible and the story really made the perspective come true. I pictured every scene vividly as if I lived it! Good job Anthony Reynolds as your book is one of few books I completed read. This was a masterpiece and a beautiful story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great book, can't wait for more League of Legends Novels!
reviews.reviewText: The new king of Camavor must prove he is worthy of such a position, for he is one of the youngest kings. Young, arrogant and narcissistic, Viego's reckless decisions have put Camavor at a risk the empire has yet to conquer. When Isolde, Veigo's wife, becomes dangerously ill, Kalista sets out on a journey for a fabled cure. Meeting various helpful allies and various, unexpectedly, vengeful foes, Kalista finds herself torn between standing beside the only family she has left or doing what is right for the empire that her ancestors have built.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars There better be a sequel!
reviews.reviewText: This book reminded me a lot of the Mistborn books by Branden Sanderson. Ruination even called a specific relic space "The Well of Ages," which feels like a mix of the "Well of Ascension" and "Hero of Ages" from Mistborn. Ruination is a political fantasy, but also a character-driven fantasy. You are introduced to various characters, follow how they react to different situations and other characters, and a progressive overarching story that involves them all reaches a climax in part three. The writing style flows without being too high-brow and not too young/childish either. If you're a fan of fantasy that isn't overly pretentious, you'll like this book. If you are a League of Legends lore fan, you'll like this book. Highly recommended, and there better be a sequel that builds on the Sentiel storyline. Senna and Lucian, anyone!? And Vennix should be a playable character - just saying!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible Journey BUT ....
reviews.reviewText: I like the story very much from start to finish. It was a very vivid journey, and I love and love-hate every character except one. Necrit's homage.His true role was not what I was expecting. I don't want to speak for Necrit in how he might feel about his character or his role in crafting the character in this novel but ... I would be a little offended due to the dedication he has for the lore of this game. His role was a bit dull in the beginning and then confusing when big events occurred.Other than that, the book confirmed my thought that Viego is a spoiled boy in a pronged crown and proved to me that Kalista deserved better and so much more. I hope that there's more to the Ruination story to come. A conclusion with the next generation would be nice.10/10, would recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Family is Everything
reviews.reviewText: If you're like me, and you're more into League of Legends lore than the game, you might very much enjoy this. This book blew me away with the details of the events that lead up to the Ruination; an event that has intrigued me for a long time, and it's captured so well from start to finish. Because of this I have stronger attachments to some of the characters, a better understanding of how some came to be, and desperately wish for more novels in this franchise to appear.You know how you have an established franchise where you know what's going to happen, so you read a book about it and you feel dread knowing what's coming and there's no way to stop it? That's how I felt reading this book, and I loved it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great first novel in the world of Runeterra
reviews.reviewText: (Spoiler free) I read this book already knowing all the lore behind the characters in this book, and let me tell you that did not impact the story for me what so ever. Even though I knew what the book would lead up to and how it would end, I was pleased with the surprising reveals I got throughout the novel. The novel presents new questions and mysteries that makes you thrilled and curious to find out what happens next. If you already know what happens at the end of the story don’t worry this novel has a bunch of intricate twists and turns to reel you in and still add tons of mystery no matter how much you already know about the world.
Ainda não li, mas a versão americana da de 10 a 0 na brasilseira em qualidade e aparencia
El producto llegó intacto, a escasos momentos después de las 24 horas de haber sido comprado.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good read and in good condition
reviews.reviewText: If you like Legue of Legends lore you definitely need to read it. Even if it looks like the story it's gonna be told from the point of view of Viego, it's not like that, it's actually Kalista the one who conducts the story line.Beatiful wording and nice art at the end, it is a must to have.
Blev en super bra julklapp till mindotter.Hon gillade den stort.
